intro: Senecio meyeri-johannis subsp. olomotiensis, commonly known as the Olomotien Senecio, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to flourish in challenging conditions.
